title: Why does socialism always fail and hurt the economy in simple terms? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wonder how someone can hurt the economy in simple terms… Oh, you mean that I need to use simple terms to describe how socialism fails and hurts the economy. I get it. It does not.  (note that the USSR started out in a much worse place than America, which was dominated by educated bourgeois people since the colonial days).  The USSR started out poor, but then it became the 2nd richest country in the world; it was a country that defeated the Nazis even after the massacres that the Soviets received. The military was strong enough to scare the shit out of America, and womens’ rights were championed. Hell, the 40-hour work week was invented in the USSR from the start, while we still have Americans working 3 jobs every day just to pay for the bills. There was universal employment, so nobody was a “parasite living on welfare”. Welfare did not exist in the USSR, as most “welfare programs” were rights in the USSR that those who worked (except children, elderly, and disabled; they got their needs even without working) had. China also succeeded. After the Great Leap Forward (which was mainly caused by drought), there was not a single famine. Mao educated the people, and he led the people to more social progress. Before Mao took power, women were forced to bind their feet.  After him, women were liberated, and they enjoy privileges women in “capitalist utopias” (India, Bangladesh, etc.) still lack. Unfortunately, with the return of capitalism in China comes the return of exploitation, but China is more fortunate than in most countries near it. Socialism works.
